text: Analytics and business intelligence users
rely heavily on frictionless access to data resources.
These users want a simple single-sign on experience
without needing to switch roles or reauthenticate
to access other data services.
Trusted identity propagation is a new IAM
Identity Center capability based on the OAuth 2.0 standard.
It gives data admins the ability
to individually authorize access.
So their users can have a single-sign on experience
to better navigate all their data from any
of their BI applications.
To get started, the owner of the BI application,
identity source, and data services establishes
a trusted relationship along the chain of applications.
Then, existing identities and group memberships define
who can access specific data resources.
Using trusted identity propagation,
data service administrators can manage user access
with a single set of users and groups.
Auditors can follow a user's access journey
across all the interconnected services,
and analytics users benefit by getting
a more seamless experience.
Securely operate at scale today
with IAM Identity Center.
(light music continues)
